page.title: 20OTTERY'S HOUSING
page.content: gave the signal to the firemen.One man caught the horses and hitched them to the fire engine. There were 3 family doctors who held surgeries in their homes every weekday. The cottage hospital had a resident matron and nurses.There was a casualty department and the doctors also performed quite serious operations. HOUSING Most people lived in small cottages with no bathroom and the toilet was usually outside. There were no houses in Longdogs Lane, Winters Lane, Slade Road, Chineway, Higher Ridgeway or Butts Road.The roads were not tarred and therefore very dusty. The water cart pulled by the council horses sprayed the roads to keep the dust down. Pavements were mostly cobbled.
